comment.body:
I don't think public proxies are supposed to do that unless it's your proxy, and you're logged in with your private key. Otherwise, anyone could make a mess of your proxy.

For full access to zeronet it's easy to run your own node on Windows, Linux, Apple and Android. Then you can also run your own public or private proxy, and do whatever you want with it.

I suggest we set up a **consortium of curated** zeronet public proxies to help **newbies** get started with zeronet. Zeronet is awesome..👍😀

> is it possible to do this?

No, not by design. See explanation below..😀
Do you like resilio? How dose it compare with other sync systems?
@无: I haven't looked at emule in many years. But with programs like Linux deploy running on smartphones we may see renewed interest..👍😀

Now that you can easily run a full Linux on android (Termux, Linux Deploy, Userland). I wonder if old Retroshare or Freenet would work. Retroshare works with or without Tor and i2p simultaneously. Not familiar with Tox..😀

Decentralization seeks to limit concentrated power. Which always leads to corruption and the perversion of the ideals and interest of the greater good.

Distributed seeks only to mask or obfuscate concentrated power through the corruption and perversion of the ideals and interest of the greater good.  Creating the illusion of decentralization. While limiting individual and personal power..😀

Can't see your picture. But it should be easy to connect Zeronet to an i2p service. Then connect to the Zeronet network. 

I don't have time right now. But maybe someone else can do it. No real coding. Just a matter of configuration.

I run Zeronet on a laptop and through the Userland Android app. Through an ssh terminal session. In a Linux file system.

Then all I have to do is 127.0.0.1:43110/
It works perfectly. Rock solid and robust. Minimal battery and resource usage. Try it if you're on Android. No root required. 

Of course root will give you more power. If you can handle it. 

I have some really Wild! ideas about how to integrate legacy centralized social media and federated social media through the Zeronet network..👹😆

@blurHY: It was you that said i2p works through the great firewall of China in Retroshare.

There seems to be a growing interest in Zeronet plugins for web browsers. Then all you need is a clearnet search engine like DuckDuckGo. That's just the tip of the iceberg.

I see no reason why you couldn't use Zeronet as a quasi DNS to centralized, free speech tolerant, legacy social media sites.

This would allow for a kind of zero-knowledge DNS. And resistance to take down. Then you could really kick some ass..🤭😆
I want to see browser plugins for Zeronet first. And Zeronet search results in DuckDuckGo. #JustSaying..🙂
Capitalism, AKA Usury, AKA immoral Jewish finance is just a tool of government. Not a form of government..👺🇮🇱☠️⚰️👎🌎🔥💀
Greed is a vice. Capitalism is a vice..🦠👺🇮🇱☠️⚰️🌎🔥🥀

Someday people will have a personal food replicator, and a personal nuclear powered Alita battle angel. In a world and universe with a limited population. With a finger for all those who would be king..🦠👺🇮🇱🍆☠️⚰️🌎🔥😱😆
